turns.speaker: NARA
turns.text: Sir, they've detonated an isolytic burst... a subspace tear is forming...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: NARA
turns.text: The tear is closing on us... impact in fifteen seconds...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Eject the core.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The purpose being I intend to shove it down the Son'a's throat.

turns.speaker: NARA
turns.text: Commander, if one of their weapons hits that gas...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: It's our only way out of here, Mister Nara.

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: Commander, I'm showing two Son'a ships on an intercept course.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: How long 'til they reach us?

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: Eighteen minutes...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What's inside that nebula cluster?

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: Cometary debris, pockets of unstable metreon gas... we don't want to go in there, sir...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Yes, we do.  You're relieved, Ensign. Take over at Ops.

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: I thought subspace weapons were banned by the Khitomer Accord...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Remind me to lodge a protest...

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: We're still thirty-six minutes from transmission range, sir.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We're through running from these bastards.

turns.speaker: PERIM
turns.text: They're powering their forward weapons array.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Blow out the ramscoop. Stand by full thrusters.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: They need us to mediate some territorial dispute...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We can't delay the archaeological expedition to Hanoran Two. It would put us into the middle of monsoon season...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The Diplomatic Corps is busy with Dominion negotiations.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: ... so they need us to put out one more brush fire.  Anyone remember when we used to be explorers?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: 'Yew-cheen chef-faw.'

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Deck ten.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Commander Riker...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: ... and gorgonzolla cheese.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We won't be able to go any faster than one-third impulse in that muck...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Nothing dangerous turned up in the astrometric survey...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: So where are the 'environmental concerns' the Admiral was talking about?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The only unusual readings were low levels of metaphasic radiation from interstellar dust across the region...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Admiral Dougherty wants to know why we haven't left yet...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Deck five.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: You Klingons never do anything small, do you...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Prepare the ship for departure at oh-seven-hundred hours.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: You must be planning on doing some hunting.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Go back to your quarters  That's an order.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There's a short letter I left you all, just some... sentimental nonsense... the computer will bring it to your attention at oh- four-hundred... I'd just as soon you delete it...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Fat chance. I'll post it on every monitor on the ship...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The Council has ordered a halt to the Ba'ku relocation while they conduct a top-level review.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Top level review, my ass. There'll be no cover-up of this. Not after I get...

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: My name is Sojef, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Jean-Luc Picard... my officers Doctor Crusher and Counselor Troi.

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: Would you like something to eat?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No, we're here to... rescue them.

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: As you wish. But I would ask you to disarm yourselves. This village is a sanctuary of life.

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: We came here from a solar system on the verge of self- annihilation... where technology had created weapons that threatened to destroy all life. A small group of us set off to find a new home... a home that would be isolated from the threats of other worlds.  That was three hundred and nine years ago.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You've not aged a day since then?

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: Actually, I was a good deal older when we arrived... in terms of my physical condition.

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: I wish there was a way to bring them back home.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Ask them.

turns.speaker: SOJEF
turns.text: I'm afraid there's too much bitterness... on both sides.

turns.speaker: WORF'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Bridge to Captain Picard. We are approaching sector four-four-one.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Slow to impulse. We're on our way.

turns.speaker: WORF'S COM VOICE
turns.text: I... I must have slept through my alarm. I'm on my way...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We'll skip the court martial this time... Picard out.

turns.speaker: WORF'S COM VOICE
turns.text: Worf to Picard...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes... yes, I... can hear you...

turns.speaker: WORF'S COM VOICE
turns.text: We're trying to get to you, sir...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Worf, you must hurry...

turns.speaker: WORF'S COM VOICE
turns.text: We're coming as fast as we can... we can't risk using phasers...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I understand. Tell Doctor Crusher to have a hypospray of lectrazine ready...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Worf, what the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: I've already modified a tricorder with one of his spare actuation servos. Its operational range is only seven meters but it should shut him down...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's good to have you back, Worf.  Slow to one-third. Take us in.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sensors are not picking up any ships coming from the surface...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Transmit a wide band co-variant signal. That'll get his attention.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: He might be using the planet's rings to mask his approach.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The metaphasic radiation in those rings is in a state of extreme flux. Steer clear of them, Mister Worf...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Come out, come out wherever you are...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Hmm? Oh, it's just something my mother used to...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir, if we fire a tachyon burst, it may force him to reset his shield harmonics. When he does, we could beam him out...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Make it so.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Direct hit. He's resetting his shield harmonics...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Beam him out!

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: He's activated a transport inhibitor.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Prepare to enter the atmosphere... we'll use the ionospheric boundary to shake him...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Scanners are off line!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Evasive maneuvers... heading one- four-zero mark three-one...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Do you know Gilbert and Sullivan?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: No, sir. I haven't had a chance to meet all the new crew members since I've been back...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: They're composers, Worf, from the nineteenth century. Data was rehearsing a part in H.M.S. Pinafore before he left...  "A British tar is a soaring soul, As free as a mountain bird, His energetic first should be ready to resist A dictatorial word..."

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir, inertial coupling is exceeding tolerance... if we don't release him, he may destroy both vessels...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm not letting go of him.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: The damping sequencer was damaged by phaser fire!

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Transferring controls to manual.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Did any of the hostages mention a cloaked ship during their debriefings?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: No, sir...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Debrief them again.  Have you been in a fight, Commander?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: No, sir. It is a gorch.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Gorch?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Doctor Crusher asked to talk to you when you returned...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Picard to Crusher...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Should I distribute phasers to the Ba'ku, sir...?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No. We'll be responsible for that, Mister Worf.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You need a haircut, Commander.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Accelerated hair growth is often experienced by Klingons during Jak'tahla...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: The Ba'ku could use some rest, sir. According to the geo-scan, this may be the safest area for the next few kilometers...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Very well. We'll take an hour. Break out some rations...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Isolinear tags. Their transporters can lock onto them.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We have to find shelter...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: All injector sub-systems are confirmed off-line.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Decloak the holo-ship and engage a tractor beam, Mister Worf.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: One. It's Ru'afo.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Can you beam him off?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Negative. He's established a security field around the control room...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Is there any other way to disable the injector?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: ... Population three hundred million...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Say the greeting again...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Yew-cheen chef-faw... emphasis on the 'cheen' and the 'faw'...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Oh, my God, are they vegetarians? That's not in here...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Better have the chef whip up a light balsamic vinaigrette... something that goes well with chrysanthemums...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: We've downloaded all the files on the duck blind mission as well as intelligence reports on the Son'a.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You have two days to become experts... Mister Worf, your job and mine will be to find a plan to safely capture Data.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Counselor?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: They have an incredible clarity of perception, Captain. I've never encountered a species with such mental discipline...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: The Son'a discovered an M-class planet with humanoid life six months ago. Turned out it's in us to get approval for a sociological study. The Federation Council suggested it be a joint mission...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Why was Data assigned?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: "Environmental concerns", again. An android could be safely exposed to the elements during the installation of a duck blind...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I don't see anything to suggest the Son'a have any interest in sociology...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: What are they interested in...?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Wine, women and song.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: You should feel right at home with them.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Nomadic, collectors of precious metals, jewels...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Hmm, I should feel right at home with them...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: You're in luck... it says here they've taken women from several races as indentured servants.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Why would we be involved with these people?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Good question.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: You haven't done that in a long time...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What you're doing to my neck...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Was I doing something to your neck?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: It says here that some form of genetic damage has apparently prevented the Son'a from procreating...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: No children?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: If that's true, they're a dying race.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Come in.  Hi.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Got a minute? I... need a little counseling.  First time for everything. Do I... lie down... or what?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Whatever makes you comfortable...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: This isn't one of the usual therapeutic postures...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: But it's comfortable.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Why don't you try sitting up?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Or you could try lying down.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: You're in quite a mood today.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Both.  I think I'm having a mid-life crisis...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: ... I believe you...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: ... I'm not sleeping well...

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: ... Doctor Crusher has something that'll take care of that...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: What I need, I can't get from Doctor Crusher...  Counselor, do you think it's possible for two people to go back in time to fix a mistake they've made?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: On this ship, anything can happen. And usually does.

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: Augh.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Augh?

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: I never kissed you with a beard before.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: All hands. Battle stations!

turns.speaker: TROI
turns.text: And have you noticed how your boobs have started to firm up?

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Initiate launch sequence.

turns.speaker: SON'A OFFICER #2
turns.text: Activating injector assembly.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Exactly as the simulations predicted...

turns.speaker: SON'A OFFICER #2
turns.text: Sir, I am not showing any change in metaphasic flux levels...

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Your scanners must be malfunctioning.

turns.speaker: SON'A OFFICER #2
turns.text: All ship functions are off-line.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: This ship is equipped with fourteen long range transporters... are they all useless...?

turns.speaker: SON'A OFFICER #2
turns.text: They must have been locked and secured after we were beamed here.

turns.speaker: RU'AFO
turns.text: Isolate one and re-route its command sequence through the auxiliary processor...

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL HAYES
turns.text: The new quantum torpedoes are doing the trick, Jean-Luc. We've destroyed forty-seven Borg ships so far... and only lost fifteen of our own.  But one of the Borg ships has broken through our defenses, and it's heading directly for Earth. Can you handle it?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL HAYES
turns.text: Good hunting. Hayes out.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Mister Data, set a pursuit course. Maximum warp.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Admiral... what's the status of the Borg fleet?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL HAYES
turns.text: It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over.  Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're fine, sir. It will take some... time to explain.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL HAYES
turns.text: I look forward to reading your report.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Montana.  Energize.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Montana? Well, that answers everything. Why the hell are we --

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Go where? Hello? Is anyone going to tell me what we're doing here?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We're here to find Zephram Cochrane. He may be injured or dead.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Cochrane... the inventor of warp drive?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: But he's been dead for three hundred...  Oh God... we've gone back in time again, haven't we?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm afraid so. If the Borg succeed in preventing First Contact with the Vulcans... Earth will remain in the Second Dark Age... an easy target when the Borg arrive in the 24th century.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Well, why didn't you just say so in the first place?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's Cochrane.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I've stabilized him for now... but he's in a coma and he's going to need radiometric therapy. I want to take him to the ship.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's not the radiation... and there's nothing wrong with the combadges... the Enterprise just isn't responding.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Jean-Luc, this man needs medical attention, now.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: As I recall, the town of Resurrection is about two kilometers East of here. They might have a hospital...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: What are we waiting for? Let's go.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It may not be that simple. This is an extremely difficult and paranoid time in human history.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Are you saying they won't help us?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm saying they might shoot us on sight. You have to remember... these people have watched their entire way of life collapse around them.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: There must be some good people... even in this time.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Let's hope so. Because if Cochrane dies... the future may die with him.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: He's stable... for now.  But it would be better if we could contact... our friends.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes. But until then, you'll have to make do with what you've got.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: That'll be interesting.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I have to go back to the silo. Will you be all right?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I'll be fine.  He's a different story.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You actually performed surgery...?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: It was an experience. Metal scalpels... needle and thread...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: But I had a little help. Surgical transporter. I used it to beam out most of the bone fragments from his brain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How did Doctor Almack react to that?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: He was so confused by what I was doing, I don't think he even noticed.  Any word from the Enterprise?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You think they're still up there?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If they're not... we'd better get used to living in Montana.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: That might not be so bad... at least for you.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Regardless of how I may feel about Ruby... our fates lie along different paths. Nothing can change that.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: You want some advice? Don't do this again.  You know exactly what I mean.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Beverly, there were many reasons why you and I...

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: I'd call them excuses. And the first excuse on both our lists was our "sense of duty." We convinced ourselves that it was more important than anything else. And you know what? It's not.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How long has he been unconscious?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: At least four hours.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is it Japanese?

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: Um... yeah.  Now he's going to need a respirator. Do you have one?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We have two... but we don't have the juice to run them.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: His automatic reflexes are fluctuating. We've got to get him on a respirator.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bag him.

turns.speaker: BEVERLY
turns.text: The occipital fracture is widening... we're going to have to fuse the bones...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm a little worried about some of these bone fragments. If they move any closer to the brain, we could be looking at a hemorrhage.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: You are the guiding intelligence behind the Borg...?

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Intelligence... ambition... desire... I bring order to chaos...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Have you ever wondered what it's like to have flesh?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It is impossible to imagine sensations for which I have no frame of reference.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: You've taken your first step toward perfection. How does it feel?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I do not know what you are referring to.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: That's because you haven't been properly... stimulated yet.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Do you know what this is, Data?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It would appear that you are attempting to graft organic skin onto my endo-skeletal structure.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: What a cold description... for such a beautiful gift.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No. I will not betray my friends.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: They're not your friends... they've held you back... kept you from your destiny...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: That is not true. They have tried to help me.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Have they given you what I have given you? Did they even try?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I... do not want this...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: You're becoming more human all the time, Data. Now you're learning how to lie.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I wish to... go back to the way I was.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: More lies.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Have you ever know a woman? Do you know what it's like to feel her breath on your face... her skin against yours... flesh against flesh?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: My creator did not intend for me to experience these things.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: I'm your creator now.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I am... grateful for what you have given me. But I still do not wish to be assimilated.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: A universe of sensation is waiting for you... don't you want to explore it... with me?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Then take the final step... give me the Enterprise... and we can be together... always.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: I've deactivated the sensory inputs. That flesh on your body is just meat, now.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No... no, please... you cannot...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Isn't it better like this...?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Yes... but the Enterprise... my duty...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: ... is to yourself. Don't make me hurt you again...

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No... no, it's so... empty... please... give it back... I need it...

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: And I need to control this ship. Let me into your mind.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: There is a perimeter alert. A ship has entered sensor range.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Vulcan?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Can you configure it?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I believe so.

turns.speaker: BORG QUEEN
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Dispersive armor is holding.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Bring us about. Target Borg ship alpha four, port side battery.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The Borg ship has modified its shields, Captain. Our phasers will no longer be effective.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Ready quantum torpedo.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: We are approaching the Terran System, Captain.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Go to impulse. Where's the Borg ship?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: It has entered Earth orbit.  Correction -- it is not in orbit. It is heading directly toward the surface.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: I have helm control.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Where's the Sphere?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: The vortex is collapsing, sir.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Contact Starfleet Command.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What year is it?

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: According to our astrometric readings... the year is 2063.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Mister Data, I want to know the exact date and time.  Give me a damage report on that missile silo.

turns.speaker: DATA
turns.text: Today is March second, 2063. The time in Montana is oh-eight-forty- five.
